Sure, here are a few examples of horticultural oils and soaps that can be effective against Magnolia scale infestation:

1. Neem oil: This is a natural oil extracted from the neem tree that can suffocate and repel Magnolia scales. It can be mixed with water and sprayed on the tree according to label instructions.

2. Insecticidal soap: This is a solution containing potassium salts of fatty acids that can also suffocate and repel Magnolia scales. It can be sprayed on the tree directly, but it is important to rinse the tree with water after applying to avoid damage to the leaves.

3. Dormant oil: This is a heavier type of horticultural oil used in the dormant season to smother Magnolia scale eggs before they hatch. It can be applied during the winter or early spring before the buds break.

4. All Seasons Spray Oil: This is a horticultural oil that can be used year-round to control Magnolia scales and other insect pests. It can be mixed with water and sprayed on the tree according to label instructions.

Before using any horticultural oil or soap, always read the label instructions carefully and follow them closely to avoid harming the tree or the environment. Also, keep in mind that repeated use of any insecticide can lead to resistance, so it is important to rotate or combine different methods of pest control.
